title: Why is Ashoka a legendary king? - Quora

response.answer_text: He was highly regarded in his lifetime for his enlightened rule and concern for his citizens. It completed one of the most remarkable transformations of any political leaders. In later life, he was referred to as Priyadarsin He who regards everyone with affection His ‘Ashoka Chakra’ was adopted as the symbol of Independent India in 1947.  Ashoka was the grandson of Chandragupta Maurya who founded the Mauryan dynasty. His father was Bindusara (Vindusar), who was widely considered to be a good ruler of the kingdom. After Ashoka’s death, the Mauryan empire only lasted another 50 years, but Ashoka became remembered as one of the most exemplary rulers in history. https://www.biographyonline.net/royalty/ashoka-biography.html
